trans-unit.source: Manage your StorSimple bandwidth templates | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage your StorSimple bandwidth templates | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to manage StorSimple bandwidth templates, which allow you to control bandwidth consumption.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to manage StorSimple bandwidth templates, which allow you to control bandwidth consumption.

trans-unit.source: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage StorSimple bandwidth templates
trans-unit.target: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage StorSimple bandwidth templates

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Bandwidth templates allow you to configure multiple time-of-day schedules to tier the data from the StorSimple device to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Bandwidth templates allow you to configure multiple time-of-day schedules to tier the data from the StorSimple device to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You can also create, modify, delete, and save these schedules as templates.
trans-unit.target: You can also create, modify, delete, and save these schedules as templates.

trans-unit.source: These bandwidth templates can then be applied across volume containers to control the bandwidth consumed by your StorSimple device when performing operations that involve the cloud.
trans-unit.target: These bandwidth templates can then be applied across volume containers to control the bandwidth consumed by your StorSimple device when performing operations that involve the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your bandwidth usage pattern, you can also choose from a list of default templates.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your bandwidth usage pattern, you can also choose from a list of default templates.

trans-unit.source: With bandwidth throttling schedules you can:
trans-unit.target: With bandwidth throttling schedules you can:

trans-unit.source: Specify schedules that customize bandwidth usage depending on the workloads.
trans-unit.target: Specify schedules that customize bandwidth usage depending on the workloads.

trans-unit.source: Centralize management and reuse the schedules across multiple devices in an easy and seamless manner.
trans-unit.target: Centralize management and reuse the schedules across multiple devices in an easy and seamless manner.

trans-unit.source: This feature is available only for StorSimple physical devices and not for virtual devices.
trans-unit.target: This feature is available only for StorSimple physical devices and not for virtual devices.

trans-unit.source: All the bandwidth templates for your service are displayed in a tabular format, and contain the following information:
trans-unit.target: All the bandwidth templates for your service are displayed in a tabular format, and contain the following information:

trans-unit.source: **Name** – A unique name assigned to the bandwidth template when it was created.
trans-unit.target: **Name** – A unique name assigned to the bandwidth template when it was created.

trans-unit.source: **Schedule** – The number of schedules contained in a given bandwidth template.
trans-unit.target: **Schedule** – The number of schedules contained in a given bandwidth template.

trans-unit.source: **Used by** – The number of volumes using the bandwidth templates.
trans-unit.target: **Used by** – The number of volumes using the bandwidth templates.

trans-unit.source: You use the StorSimple Manager service **Configure** page in the Management Portal to manage bandwidth templates.
trans-unit.target: You use the StorSimple Manager service **Configure** page in the Management Portal to manage bandwidth templates.

trans-unit.source: The most common tasks related to bandwidth templates that can be performed on this page are:
trans-unit.target: The most common tasks related to bandwidth templates that can be performed on this page are:

trans-unit.source: Add a bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: Add a bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Edit a bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: Edit a bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Delete a bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: Delete a bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Use a default bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: Use a default bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Create an all-day bandwidth template that starts at a specified time
trans-unit.target: Create an all-day bandwidth template that starts at a specified time

trans-unit.source: You can also find additional information to help configure bandwidth templates in:
trans-unit.target: You can also find additional information to help configure bandwidth templates in:

trans-unit.source: Questions and answers about bandwidth templates
trans-unit.target: Questions and answers about bandwidth templates

trans-unit.source: Best practices for bandwidth templates
trans-unit.target: Best practices for bandwidth templates

trans-unit.source: Add a bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: Add a bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to create a new bandwidth template.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to create a new bandwidth template.

trans-unit.source: To add a bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: To add a bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: On the StorSimple Manager service **Configure** page, click **add/edit bandwidth template**.
trans-unit.target: On the StorSimple Manager service **Configure** page, click **add/edit bandwidth template**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add/Edit Bandwidth Template** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Add/Edit Bandwidth Template** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: From the **Template** drop-down list, select **Create new** to add a new bandwidth template.
trans-unit.target: From the **Template** drop-down list, select **Create new** to add a new bandwidth template.

trans-unit.source: Specify a unique name for your bandwidth template.
trans-unit.target: Specify a unique name for your bandwidth template.

trans-unit.source: Define a **Bandwidth Schedule**.
trans-unit.target: Define a **Bandwidth Schedule**.

trans-unit.source: To create a schedule:
trans-unit.target: To create a schedule:

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down list, choose the days of the week the schedule is configured for.
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down list, choose the days of the week the schedule is configured for.

trans-unit.source: You can select multiple days by selecting the check boxes located before the respective days in the list.
trans-unit.target: You can select multiple days by selecting the check boxes located before the respective days in the list.

trans-unit.source: Select the **All Day** option if the schedule is enforced for the entire day.
trans-unit.target: Select the **All Day** option if the schedule is enforced for the entire day.

trans-unit.source: When this option is checked, you can no longer specify a **Start Time** or an **End Time**.
trans-unit.target: When this option is checked, you can no longer specify a **Start Time** or an **End Time**.

trans-unit.source: The schedule runs from 12:00 AM to 11:59 PM.
trans-unit.target: The schedule runs from 12:00 AM to 11:59 PM.

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down list, select a **Start Time**.
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down list, select a **Start Time**.

trans-unit.source: This is when the schedule will begin.
trans-unit.target: This is when the schedule will begin.

trans-unit.source: From the drop-down list, select an **End Time**.
trans-unit.target: From the drop-down list, select an **End Time**.

trans-unit.source: This is when the schedule will stop.
trans-unit.target: This is when the schedule will stop.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Overlapping schedules are not allowed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Overlapping schedules are not allowed.

trans-unit.source: If the start and end times will result in an overlapping schedule, you will see an error message to that effect.
trans-unit.target: If the start and end times will result in an overlapping schedule, you will see an error message to that effect.

trans-unit.source: Specify the **Bandwidth Rate**.
trans-unit.target: Specify the **Bandwidth Rate**.

trans-unit.source: This is the bandwidth in Megabits per second (Mbps) used by your StorSimple device in operations involving the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This is the bandwidth in Megabits per second (Mbps) used by your StorSimple device in operations involving the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Supply a number between 1 and 1,000 for this field.
trans-unit.target: Supply a number between 1 and 1,000 for this field.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon ![Check icon](./media/storsimple-manage-bandwidth-templates/HCS_CheckIcon.png).
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon ![Check icon](./media/storsimple-manage-bandwidth-templates/HCS_CheckIcon.png).

trans-unit.source: The template that you have created will be added to the list of bandwidth templates on the service **Configure** page.
trans-unit.target: The template that you have created will be added to the list of bandwidth templates on the service **Configure** page.

trans-unit.source: Create new bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: Create new bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** at the bottom of the page and then click **Yes** when prompted for confirmation.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** at the bottom of the page and then click **Yes** when prompted for confirmation.

trans-unit.source: This will save the configuration changes that you have made.
trans-unit.target: This will save the configuration changes that you have made.

trans-unit.source: Edit a bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: Edit a bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to edit a bandwidth template.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to edit a bandwidth template.

trans-unit.source: To edit a bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: To edit a bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Click **add/edit bandwidth template**.
trans-unit.target: Click **add/edit bandwidth template**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add/Edit Bandwidth Template** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Add/Edit Bandwidth Template** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: From the **Template** drop-down list, choose an existing bandwidth template that you want to modify.
trans-unit.target: From the **Template** drop-down list, choose an existing bandwidth template that you want to modify.

trans-unit.source: Complete your changes.
trans-unit.target: Complete your changes.

trans-unit.source: (You can modify any of the existing settings.)
trans-unit.target: (You can modify any of the existing settings.)

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon

trans-unit.source: Check icon
trans-unit.target: Check icon

trans-unit.source: You will see the modified template in the list of bandwidth templates on the service Configure page.
trans-unit.target: You will see the modified template in the list of bandwidth templates on the service Configure page.

trans-unit.source: To save your changes, click **Save** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: To save your changes, click **Save** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click **Yes** when prompted for confirmation.
trans-unit.target: Click **Yes** when prompted for confirmation.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You will not be allowed to save your changes if the edited schedule overlaps with an existing schedule in the bandwidth template that you are modifying.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You will not be allowed to save your changes if the edited schedule overlaps with an existing schedule in the bandwidth template that you are modifying.

trans-unit.source: Delete a bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: Delete a bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to delete a bandwidth template.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to delete a bandwidth template.

trans-unit.source: To delete a bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: To delete a bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: In the tabular list of the bandwidth templates for your service, select the template that you wish to delete.
trans-unit.target: In the tabular list of the bandwidth templates for your service, select the template that you wish to delete.

trans-unit.source: A delete icon (**x**) will appear to the extreme right of the selected template.
trans-unit.target: A delete icon (**x**) will appear to the extreme right of the selected template.

trans-unit.source: Click the **x** icon to delete the template.
trans-unit.target: Click the **x** icon to delete the template.

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted for confirmation.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted for confirmation.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to proceed.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to proceed.

trans-unit.source: If the template is in use by any volume(s), you will not be allowed to delete it.
trans-unit.target: If the template is in use by any volume(s), you will not be allowed to delete it.

trans-unit.source: You will see an error message indicating that the template is in use.
trans-unit.target: You will see an error message indicating that the template is in use.

trans-unit.source: An error message dialog box will appear advising you that all the references to the template should be removed.
trans-unit.target: An error message dialog box will appear advising you that all the references to the template should be removed.

trans-unit.source: You can delete all the references to the template by accessing the **Volume Containers** page and modifying the volume containers that use this template so that they use another template or use a custom or unlimited bandwidth setting.
trans-unit.target: You can delete all the references to the template by accessing the **Volume Containers** page and modifying the volume containers that use this template so that they use another template or use a custom or unlimited bandwidth setting.

trans-unit.source: When all the references have been removed, you can delete the template.
trans-unit.target: When all the references have been removed, you can delete the template.

trans-unit.source: Use a default bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: Use a default bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: A default bandwidth template is provided and is used by volume containers by default to enforce bandwidth controls when accessing the cloud.
trans-unit.target: A default bandwidth template is provided and is used by volume containers by default to enforce bandwidth controls when accessing the cloud.

trans-unit.source: The default template also serves as a ready reference for users who create their own templates.
trans-unit.target: The default template also serves as a ready reference for users who create their own templates.

trans-unit.source: The details of this default template are:
trans-unit.target: The details of this default template are:

trans-unit.source: **Name** – Unlimited nights and weekends
trans-unit.target: **Name** – Unlimited nights and weekends

trans-unit.source: **Schedule** – A single schedule from Monday to Friday that applies a bandwidth rate of 1 Mbps between 8 AM and 5 PM device time.
trans-unit.target: **Schedule** – A single schedule from Monday to Friday that applies a bandwidth rate of 1 Mbps between 8 AM and 5 PM device time.

trans-unit.source: The bandwidth is set to Unlimited for the remainder of the week.
trans-unit.target: The bandwidth is set to Unlimited for the remainder of the week.

trans-unit.source: The default template can be edited.
trans-unit.target: The default template can be edited.

trans-unit.source: The usage of this template (including edited versions) is tracked.
trans-unit.target: The usage of this template (including edited versions) is tracked.

trans-unit.source: Create an all-day bandwidth template that starts at a specified time
trans-unit.target: Create an all-day bandwidth template that starts at a specified time

trans-unit.source: Follow this procedure to create a schedule that starts at a specified time and runs all day.
trans-unit.target: Follow this procedure to create a schedule that starts at a specified time and runs all day.

trans-unit.source: In the example, the schedule starts at 9 AM in the morning and runs until 9 AM the next morning.
trans-unit.target: In the example, the schedule starts at 9 AM in the morning and runs until 9 AM the next morning.

trans-unit.source: It's important to note that the start and end times for a given schedule must both be contained on the same 24 hour schedule and cannot span multiple days.
trans-unit.target: It's important to note that the start and end times for a given schedule must both be contained on the same 24 hour schedule and cannot span multiple days.

trans-unit.source: If you need to set up bandwidth templates that span multiple days, you will need to use multiple schedules (as shown in the example).
trans-unit.target: If you need to set up bandwidth templates that span multiple days, you will need to use multiple schedules (as shown in the example).

trans-unit.source: To create an all-day bandwidth template
trans-unit.target: To create an all-day bandwidth template

trans-unit.source: Create a schedule that starts at 9 AM in the morning and runs until midnight.
trans-unit.target: Create a schedule that starts at 9 AM in the morning and runs until midnight.

trans-unit.source: Add another schedule.
trans-unit.target: Add another schedule.

trans-unit.source: Configure the second schedule to run from midnight until 9 AM in the morning.
trans-unit.target: Configure the second schedule to run from midnight until 9 AM in the morning.

trans-unit.source: Save the bandwidth template.
trans-unit.target: Save the bandwidth template.

trans-unit.source: The composite schedule will then start at a time of your choosing and run all-day.
trans-unit.target: The composite schedule will then start at a time of your choosing and run all-day.

trans-unit.source: Questions and answers about bandwidth templates
trans-unit.target: Questions and answers about bandwidth templates

trans-unit.source: What happens to bandwidth controls when you are in between the schedules?
trans-unit.target: What happens to bandwidth controls when you are in between the schedules?

trans-unit.source: (A schedule has ended and another one has not started yet.)
trans-unit.target: (A schedule has ended and another one has not started yet.)

trans-unit.source: In such cases, no bandwidth controls will be employed.
trans-unit.target: In such cases, no bandwidth controls will be employed.

trans-unit.source: This means that the device can use unlimited bandwidth when tiering data to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: This means that the device can use unlimited bandwidth when tiering data to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Can you modify bandwidth templates on an offline device?
trans-unit.target: Can you modify bandwidth templates on an offline device?

trans-unit.source: You will not be able to modify bandwidth templates on volumes containers if the corresponding device is offline.
trans-unit.target: You will not be able to modify bandwidth templates on volumes containers if the corresponding device is offline.

trans-unit.source: Can you edit a bandwidth template associated with a volume container when the associated volumes are offline?
trans-unit.target: Can you edit a bandwidth template associated with a volume container when the associated volumes are offline?

trans-unit.source: You can modify a bandwidth template associated with a volume container whose volumes are offline.
trans-unit.target: You can modify a bandwidth template associated with a volume container whose volumes are offline.

trans-unit.source: Note that when volumes are offline, no data will be tiered from the device to the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Note that when volumes are offline, no data will be tiered from the device to the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Can you delete a default template?
trans-unit.target: Can you delete a default template?

trans-unit.source: Although you can delete a default template, it is not a good idea to do so.
trans-unit.target: Although you can delete a default template, it is not a good idea to do so.

trans-unit.source: The usage of a default template, including edited versions, is tracked.
trans-unit.target: The usage of a default template, including edited versions, is tracked.

trans-unit.source: The tracking data is analyzed and over the course of time, is used to improve the default template.
trans-unit.target: The tracking data is analyzed and over the course of time, is used to improve the default template.

trans-unit.source: How do you determine that your bandwidth templates need to be modified?
trans-unit.target: How do you determine that your bandwidth templates need to be modified?

trans-unit.source: One of the signs that you need to modify the bandwidth templates is when you start seeing the network slow down or choke multiple times in a day.
trans-unit.target: One of the signs that you need to modify the bandwidth templates is when you start seeing the network slow down or choke multiple times in a day.

trans-unit.source: If this happens, monitor the storage and usage network by looking at the I/O Performance and Network Throughput charts.
trans-unit.target: If this happens, monitor the storage and usage network by looking at the I/O Performance and Network Throughput charts.

trans-unit.source: From the network throughput data, identify the time of day and the volume containers in which the network bottleneck occurs.
trans-unit.target: From the network throughput data, identify the time of day and the volume containers in which the network bottleneck occurs.

trans-unit.source: If this happens when data is being tiered to the cloud (get this information from I/O performance for all volume containers for device to cloud), then you will need to modify the bandwidth templates associated with your volume containers.
trans-unit.target: If this happens when data is being tiered to the cloud (get this information from I/O performance for all volume containers for device to cloud), then you will need to modify the bandwidth templates associated with your volume containers.

trans-unit.source: After the modified templates are in use, you will need to monitor the network again for significant latencies.
trans-unit.target: After the modified templates are in use, you will need to monitor the network again for significant latencies.

trans-unit.source: If these still exist, then you will need to revisit your bandwidth templates.
trans-unit.target: If these still exist, then you will need to revisit your bandwidth templates.

trans-unit.source: What happens if multiple volume containers on my device have schedules that overlap but different limits apply to each?
trans-unit.target: What happens if multiple volume containers on my device have schedules that overlap but different limits apply to each?

trans-unit.source: Let's assume that you have a device with 3 volume containers.
trans-unit.target: Let's assume that you have a device with 3 volume containers.

trans-unit.source: The schedules associated with these containers completely overlap.
trans-unit.target: The schedules associated with these containers completely overlap.

trans-unit.source: For each of these containers, the bandwidth limits used are 5, 10, and 15 Mbps respectively.
trans-unit.target: For each of these containers, the bandwidth limits used are 5, 10, and 15 Mbps respectively.

trans-unit.source: When I/Os are occurring on all of these containers at the same time, the minimum of the 3 bandwidth limits may be applied: in this case, 5 Mbps as these outgoing I/O requests share the same queue.
trans-unit.target: When I/Os are occurring on all of these containers at the same time, the minimum of the 3 bandwidth limits may be applied: in this case, 5 Mbps as these outgoing I/O requests share the same queue.

trans-unit.source: Best practices for bandwidth templates
trans-unit.target: Best practices for bandwidth templates

trans-unit.source: Follow these best practices for your StorSimple device:
trans-unit.target: Follow these best practices for your StorSimple device:

trans-unit.source: Configure bandwidth templates on your device to enable variable throttling of the network throughput by the device at different times of the day.
trans-unit.target: Configure bandwidth templates on your device to enable variable throttling of the network throughput by the device at different times of the day.

trans-unit.source: These bandwidth templates when used with backup schedules can effectively leverage additional network bandwidth for cloud operations during off-peak hours.
trans-unit.target: These bandwidth templates when used with backup schedules can effectively leverage additional network bandwidth for cloud operations during off-peak hours.

trans-unit.source: Calculate the actual bandwidth required for a particular deployment based on the size of the deployment and the required recovery time objective (RTO).
trans-unit.target: Calculate the actual bandwidth required for a particular deployment based on the size of the deployment and the required recovery time objective (RTO).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Read more about [StorSimple components](storsimple-components.md).
